newsitem.title: CYPRUS: One killed, four injured in Cyprus rally crash.
newsitem.headline: One killed, four injured in Cyprus rally crash.

text.p: One woman was killed and four people were injured when a car ploughed into a group of spectators at the 24th Rothmans Cyprus Rally late on Friday, police said on Saturday.

Police said a 24-year-old woman was killed and four people were injured, two critically, when one of the cars taking part in the 950-km (590-mile) run veered off a dirt track some 20 km (12 miles) southwest of Nicosia and plunged into them.
"It is the first time something like this has happened," said one of the rally organisers. The driver, Cypriot Marios Politas, dropped out of the event.
The accident occurred a few hours after the rally, one of the major sporting events in Cyprus, started in the capital Nicosia. The rally is due to end on Sunday afternoon.
